definition: to keep watch and defend one another (idiom, from Mencius); to join forces to defend against external aggressors/mutual help and protection
to guard/to defend/to keep watch/to abide by the law/to observe (rules or ritual)/nearby/adjoining
full moon/to hope/to expect/to visit/to gaze (into the distance)/to look towards/towards
appearance/portrait/picture/government minister/(physics) phase/(literary) to appraise (esp. by scrutinizing physical features)/to read sb's fortune (by physiognomy, palmistry etc)
each other/one another/mutually/fret on the neck of a pipa 琵琶[pi2 pa5] (a fret on the soundboard is called a 品[pin3])
surname Xiang
to help/to assist

sentences.english: The two peoples have the tradition of helping and supporting each other.
sentences.chinese: 中智兩國人民素有守望相助的傳統。

sentences.english: Participants helped each other to avoid obstacles on the way.
sentences.chinese: 參加者守望相助，互相提點，避免碰到障礙物。

sentences.english: Fourth, , we should remain committed to mutual assistance in security.
sentences.chinese: 第四，堅持安全上守望相助。

cross a river in the same boat (idiom); fig. having common interests/obliged to collaborate towards common goals
of one mind (idiom)
to be of one mind/to work as one
neighborly relations

to resist the enemy
to live in harmony/to get along with each other
unity of will is an impregnable stronghold (idiom)

to unite/unity/solidarity/united
to work with a common purpose (idiom); to make concerted efforts/to pull together/to work as one
